pics.caption: You're allowed to order one mochi ice cream per person as part of the sushi buffet
Sashimi salad and baby octopus salad
It you order enough rolls, it comes in a boat!

review.des:
There are some pretty hit-or-miss AYCE sushi places in the world (I've been to a few in NYC), but this is, happily, not one of them. The main differentiation of Sushi Taku is the quality of the appetizers and the nigiri. I know you're not supposed to go to AYCE places for the appetizers, but all of their apps were so unique and delicious, much better than the typical miso soup + edamame combos offered at other places.

Their nigiri has so much fresh fish, including ample amounts of eel and salmon especially. I also loved the simple sushi rolls. All of the rolls had a great fish: rice ratio and didn't try to drown you with rice overload.

I'm docking one star for some of the strange special sushi rolls, especially some of the sour/spicy ones...but stick with the classics and you've got a home run here, topped off by perfect service!

Don't forget to order mochi ice cream for dessert, but don't order the green tea mochi. The others are delicious.

It wasn't my favorite, but it stands out.

I would come to sushi taku for the appetizers and good service. They have a good variety of appetizers that can't be turned down.

I did go ahead and get the sashimi salad because it was all the rave and I think this filled my weak stomach so much I couldn't continue with my AYCE journey. It has a wasabi dressing and large pieces of fish. Can't complain. I also like the fried oysters and soft shell crab. I don't like the miso soup (diluted).

Nigiris: scallop is small but good. Yellowtail was good but not cut with care. It still had pink underbelly.

The volcano roll is good but everything else I got was a let down because they all had tempura. Maybe it was just the day but all the tempura tastes old. Pretty unenjoyable.

The price was ok. Would I come again, myeeeeh (for sashimi salad) Got my fair share of appetizers, some rolls, and mochi

The hype is real!

My friends and I tried this AYCE spot and were just so happy with every aspect of it! Our server was so incredibly friendly, attentive, helpful and even offered to take a photo of us with our big sushi boat! I mentioned in passing that it was my friend's birthday and she brought out a dessert for her on the house! Gosh darn sweet lady!

They have a few beers you can order, as well as wines.
Pro-Tip: Lagunitas is $4.50 and Sapporo is $5. Make the smart decision here. :P

On the non-sushi front, we tried the Chicken Karage which is always a favorite of mine. It  was so good, we got a second order!

My friends and I really want the sushi boat! Just know you need to order a hecka lot to get the boat. I found their sashimi to be A-OK, not the best but it wasn't bad either and had a completely acceptable level of freshness. The rolls at Sushi Taku are really where it's at though.

They didn't put an exorbitant amount of rice in their rolls and they were all nicely packed. Some of the standouts for me were the:
~Sweet Potato Roll - Honestly one of the best I've had and I have a sweet potato roll addiction so that's saying something. This is the only maki I found to have a tad too much rice but it was still really tasty.
~Chicago Roll - I put on for my city, on on for my city!!!! This was an interesting roll stuffed with asparagus and tempura white fish, topped with spicy salmon & spicy mayo plus some tempura crumbs. Loved this roll though I did not find it very spicy at all and I'm pretty weak.
~Spicy 2 in 1 Roll - This packed a bit more punch with spicy tuna & spicy salmon with a bit of a crunch, as well.

They have a surprising number of desserts if you can find a little space left in your belly. I had some Red Bean ice cream and loved it. Kind of funny, but they have a limit on mochi ice cream pieces, one per person! So no limit on crab or other expensive seafood - just the mochi ice cream! :P

I really enjoyed my dinner at Sushi Taku and am so happy this amazing AYCE option has come to West Town!

My first AYCE sushi restaurant experience in Chicago! This place is good, not the best, but a great experience overall. We left with our palates feeling especially catered to with the inclusion of so many different flavors from the specialty rolls and stomachs stuffed to the brim. It's $18.99 for lunch and $23.99 for dinner. My boyfriend and I booked a reservation here for a Monday night to celebrate my birthday. There was a decent number of people even for a early weekday night, and we were seated right away at a table for two. This restaurant is great for both 1-2 people and large groups (I saw a large group having a blast at a long table near the entrance).

The ambiance is typical for Wicker Park, with bright colors and a trendier, younger feel to the restaurant as well as the demographic. Service was fantastic, fast, and had all of the appetizers and specialty rolls prepared to bring out all at once. AYCE is similar to other places, except a little more special because even the appetizers, nigiri, specialty rolls, and desserts are included! Some places place restrictions on what you can order from the menu, and so this was excellent.

Appetizers
Takoyaki
I really wanted this to be amazing, mostly because I was craving it, but alas, the doughiness wasn't the best first impression. Takoyaki is a round fried ball of wheat flour with a piece of octopus inside. This wasn't crispy on the outside, and a little too mushy. It is also quite filling so I wouldn't necessarily recommend this for AYCE.

Jalapeno Poppers
What a surprise! This is a new addition to any Japanese menu I've seen, but it was delicious. Cooked tuna inside jalapeno shells, with sauce drizzled on it, this one wowed us, albeit left us panting for water.

Specialty Rolls
Fire Phoenix Roll
This one was a little disappointing, because we couldn't really taste the salmon on it, mostly because it was overpowered by the wasabi in the roll. The wasabi was not mentioned on the menu ingredients. Otherwise, it would have been a cooked salmon star.

Sapporo Roll
My personal favorite. This one was the most uniquely flavored, with spicy tuna, crab, avocado, cucumber, and tempura crunch on top. The spicy tuna was a good complement to the other rolls that we had, even if my bf wanted it to be more spicy.

Crazy Kani Roll
Shrimp tempura crunch all around. That was all we could taste with this roll, but we weren't made about it haha. A solid fried specialty roll.

Color Dragon Roll
Wowser, beats the original dragon roll by a mile. Topped with eel, tuna, avocado, tobiko, scallion, and eel sauce, there were the most extravagant of toppings that I've seen in a specialty roll.

Dessert
Green Tea Mochi Ice Cream
Since we were both so full, we ended up splitting one green tea mochi ice cream ball. Refreshing after all that sushi, but not the strongest green tea flavor that I've had. This is pretty close to the Trader Joe's version of mochi ice cream.

Great AYCE sushi place, with reasonable prices to boot!  Came here with a friend on a Saturday night-there was a wait, so we put our name in on the app and went to grab a drink next door.  The app is nice, it shows you what place you are in line, how long you've been waiting, and the size of tables that are ahead of you in line.

We ended up being seated at the sushi bar, which I didn't mind except that it was kind of cramped (especially with AYCE!).  The deal is $24 a person, and includes appetizers, salads, soups, rolls, and dessert, so you can get pretty much anything!  And we did get a bit of everything-miso soup, salad, crab rangoon, some of the specialty rolls and some of the regular rolls.  They do charge if you have leftovers, and the specialty rolls are a full 8-12 pieces, so don't let your eyes be bigger than your stomach!  We also split a bottle of wine, which was also reasonably priced at about $25.

Our server was attentive, though there were a couple times that we were winding down with what we were eating and had to wait to put our next order in.  Not a terrible thing, as it gave us time to digest (more room for sushi!) but it was a bit noticeable.  It also is very loud in there.  But a great AYCE place with reasonable prices and lots of great options.  I will be back!

pics.caption: Mango tango roll, color dragon roll,  salmon and yellowtail rolls

review.des: Great place for sushi. We did the all you can eat menu. They have a wide variety of rolls and nigiri. My boyfriend really loved their sashimi salad and we both really enjoyed their specialty rolls. The service was great our waitress Wenny was very attentive to our table. This was also our first time trying sake which was a great experience as well. Parking was a little tricky on a Saturday night as it is only street parking and most of the residential is permit only. I would recommend calling ahead for a table as their wait times were pretty long. Pricing was also fantastic for the quality. I would highly recommend this place. We will definitely be coming back!

THIS. This is as good as it gets for sure. Loved the AYCE menu that also included appetizers! All the sushi we ordered was a good sushi to rice ratio. All delicious. Waitress was attentive, always refilling our waters. The red bean ice cream was good! Green tea one wasn't sweet but you could taste the green tea. Also mochi ice cream was a win (go with people who don't like mochi so you can have their piece ;D )

Dinner price was only $24 which I thought was a good deal. I'm down to come back but will try to get on that weekday lunch price for an even better deal at just $19!

Best AYCE in Chicago for sure!
Their options for AYCE are what really set things apart. They have so many appetizers and salad options along with their specialty rolls, classic rolls, and dessert. This selection is a lot better than any other menu I have seen for AYCE. And for around the same price as other places as well!
The sushi itself is great, the fish to rice ratio is perfect which helps you from getting too full too fast. Keep in mind they do charge for leftovers so start slow and only order what you can eat. It is $1 for every specialty roll piece and $0.50 for every classic roll piece.
When I went the server only charged us $5 for $9 worth of leftovers which was great!
Will definitely be coming back soon.

My best friend and I always have long talks over stuffing out bellies with sushi so I was very excited to see a new AYCE sushi joint opening up in Wicker Park.

Parking - street parking in a very congested area. You may have to park a couple blocks away from this place.

Staff- very in top of service! They were there to refill out water, grab out orders, and ask how everything was.

Food- for an all you can eat sushi joint, this has to be top in that quality of food. I really enjoyed the bigger selection in appetizers and lots of special rolls option. Definitely tasty selection. I would definitely do more of the all you can eat. I  felt like the prices were little too steep if you order them just off of the menu.

Decent menu, but I think given the way things are priced, you are better off doing the all you can eat option. You don't have to super stuffed to break even.

We came for dinner, and it's 25$/person before tax. Really liked their salad, they come in small portions, so you can try a variety of them, the baby octopus one is really good, so is the squid one (but if you order them without the all you can eat option, it's a bit pricier for that small portion).

They also have a lot of hot appetizer that you can order, and the portion is small, which is a plus for all you can eat sushi places that normally impose penalty on not finishing the food, since you can try a variety and know when to stop. The hot dishes are pretty good for all your can eat place's standard, but it definitely does not measure up to places like Kai Zan (well, it's reflected in the price).

The only downside is they don't have sashimi, but given the selection of the choices, I think it's still one of the top all you can eat sushi places you can find in Chicago.

I love sushi and I love to eat, so when I found this AYCE sushi option, I was beyond excited.

The line gets crazy for dinner! I called on a Friday night around 6:30pm to get an update on the wait-time, which they estimated to be about 1 hour. NOTE:  They do accept call ahead seating, so I was able to put my name on the list & they texted me when the table was ready (which was only about 40 minutes later). They saved the table while I was parking the car and we were able to walk right in a get our table!

The all-you-can-eat menu is expansive with several nigiri & roll options, as well as appetizers, soups, salads and desserts. There were a lot of different Signature Rolls with my absolute favorite being the Sake Roll, which is spicy salmon/avocado roll topped with even more salmon! We got several others (Angel Hair Roll, Spicy 2 in 1 Roll & Sal-fornia Roll) that were tasty, but I would hands down ALWAYS order the Sake Roll.

We left full, pleased and definitely got more than $24.99 worth of food. It's not the world's best sushi, but for the price & AYCE, it is definitely a 5 star in my opinion. Stick to the nirgiri & rolls and you will be sure to get your money's worth!

This is one of the best AYCE sushi I've had in Chicago for sure. We came on a Friday night, so it was extremely busy and the atmosphere was lively and full of people. I would say if you want to come on a Friday or weekend night get a group of at least 6 friends and make a reservation ahead of time. Also, the more people you have the more mouths you can feed technically so more bang for your buck. My personal favorite was yellowtail sashimi and I really enjoyed their yellowtail because it was fresh and fatty. The volcano roll was also a surprisingly savory one for me but if you're not a fan of cream cheese I would not recommend. It's BYOB (if you want) and they will charge $10 for that. I think their alcohol was pretty good in my opinion. We got a lychee sake that was delicious with the sushi. The only thing that was different was that we drank it basically like wine and not the usual sake shot. Would recommend for AYCE sushi! Come hungry and expect a wait.

The AYCE both lunch and dinner is worth your money. Not much rice is given, which is pretty rare for AYCE sushi places. Appetizers were so good we ordered for seconds. Excellent service. I came here twice in one month and was never disappointed.

The first time I came I stayed for 3 hours trying to regretfully finish all the sushi that was ordered. Don't get me wrong. The food quality was fresh and delicious. Ordering too much was bad on my part.
Second time-it was all about the appetizers.
Bottom line: would go whenever to fulfill my sushi cravings. And to get the appetizers.

Found my new favorite AYCE sushi restaurant! $18.99 for lunch and $23.99 for dinner. We ordered the following appetizers and sushi rolls:

Appetizers:
- shrimp/veggie tempura (comes with 2 shrimp, broccoli, mushroom, sweet potato, onion ring and sauce)
- steamed shrimp shumai (6 pcs)
- miso soup (has some tofu)
- baked mussels (2 pcs)
- chicken karage

Sushi:
- godzilla
- rainbow
- dragon
- sapporo (my favorite!)

What I like about the sushi rolls are that they don't add a lot of rice like other AYCE sushi places.  They truly care about your experience and orders come out fast (granted the restaurant wasn't packed).

We came during lunch so we weren't able to get the mochi ice cream all the other reviews talk about. The waitress said we can pay the 23.99 price for the dessert, but it doesn't seem like the dessert is all-you-can-eat, so we didn't think it was worth it.  However, I am going here for dinner in a couple days! :)

Update: Came here again for AYCE dinner and ordered basically the whole menu. Still so good and fast even on a busy Friday night!

Tip: if you're getting the mochi cream, don't get green tea. Tastes not like green tea but flowery!
Wonderful all you can eat sushi!!  Best deal in town and great quality.  Dinner or lunch is great. They now have a patio too.
